passages.text: Market Insights 市场洞察
GS TMT SPEC SALE: Ai competition from China; VAT Group upgrade and debate; Wise UK banking licence; Wolters competition
高盛 TMT 专题销售：来自中国的人工智能竞争；VAT Group 上调评级与争论；Wise 获得英国银行牌照；Wolters 竞争
GS TMT SPEC SALES - Monday 1st September 高盛 TMT 特别销售 - 星期一 9 月 1 日

A lot of questions on the tech wobble on Friday in particular for semis (SOX ended down \(3.15\%\) , NVIDIA - 3.3%, TSM ADR - 3.1%, ASML - 2.7%). The trigger appears to have been growing competition in China's AI space after WSJ's report on Alibaba's AI chip (is developing a new AI chip; the chip is specifically for inferencing rather than training) and concerns over slower AI growth (see the - ve reactions to both Dell (- 9% weaker profit guide) + Marvel (- 18% as the lack of upside in data revenues disappointed) prints). Plus The Information released this article noting that DeepSeek is starting to utilize Huawei chips to train some of its AI models, a potential "turning point" in China's quest to reduce its reliance on Nvidia and American silicon. Not sure why China trying to become more independent surprises as Nvidia H20 have been a political pawn - with the US at one stage saying you can have them, then no you can't and now you can but they are 3rd rate. Feedback and press suggest that China is getting Huawei and SMIC to build more datacentre chips. Not helping Semicap the US Commerce Department revoked waiver for Samsung (- 3% this morning) and SK Hynix (- 5% this morning) that allowed them to ship chipmaking equipment to China (Bloomberg, Reuters). Revision to Validated End- User (VEU) authorization to take effect in 120 days, after which companies will require licenses to continue operations.

周五科技板块的波动引发了大量关注，尤其是半导体板块（SOX收跌 \(3.15\%\) ，NVIDIA - 3.3%，台积电ADR - 3.1%，ASML - 2.7%）。导火索似乎是《华尔街日报》报道阿里巴巴正在研发一款新的AI芯片（专为推理而非训练设计），引发了对中国AI领域竞争加剧的担忧，以及对AI增长放缓的担心（参见市场对戴尔（- 9%，盈利指引疲弱）和Marvel（- 18%，数据收入缺乏增长空间令人失望）财报的负面反应）。此外，《The Information》发布文章称，

DeepSeek 开始使用华为芯片来训练部分 AI 模型，这可能成为中国减少对 Nvidia 和美国芯片依赖的一个“转折点”。至于中国努力实现更高自主性，并不令人意外，因为 Nvidia H20 一直是政治博弈的棋子——美国曾一度表示可以出口，后来又说不行，现在又说可以，但只是三流版本。市场反馈和媒体报道显示，中国正推动华为和中芯国际生产更多数据中心芯片。对半导体设备行业不利的是，美国商务部撤销了对三星（今早下跌 \(3\%\) ）和 SK 海力士（今早下跌 \(5\%\) ）的豁免，该豁免此前允许它们向中国运送芯片制造设备（彭博社、路透社）。对“验证终端用户”（VEU）授权的修订将在 120 天后生效，届时公司将需要获得许可证才能继续运营。

Tariffs: US Court of Appeals rules reciprocal tariffs illegal; duties to stay in effect to allow for appeal (FT, Bloomberg, Washington Post) USTR Greer says Trump administration still working on trade deals despite US appeals court ruling deeming reciprocal tariffs illegal (Reuters)
关税：美国上诉法院裁定互征关税非法；关税将继续生效以便上诉（《金融时报》、彭博社、《华盛顿邮报》）。美国贸易代表办公室的 Greer 表示，尽管美国上诉法院裁定互征关税非法，特朗普政府仍在推进贸易协议的谈判（路透社）。

VAT Group - (followed by the Industrials team here) upgraded to Buy - getting lots of pushback (always makes for an interesting debate) as investors feel that last week at the Jefferies conference in the US the message from the VAT was more cautious and on Friday the head of semis business departed.
VAT 集团——（由此处的工业团队跟进）评级上调至“买入”——引发了大量反对意见（总是能引发有趣的讨论），因为投资者认为，上周在美国 Jefferies 会议上，VAT 传递的信息更为谨慎，而且在周五，半导体业务负责人离职。

WISE - Today press suggesting that in the UK Wise is looking to get a UK banking licence. The Times article says that the plans are understood to be at a very early stage and the company has not yet made a full application to the Bank of England for a licence. This would be a change strategy as in the past Wise as expressed no interest in a full banking license, focusing instead on its role as a money services business (MSB) or electronic money institution. That said in the US in June Wise applied for a national trust bank license application with the U.S. Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC). Should be seen as positive as will allow Wise to offer more services but will come with more regulation.

WISE——今日有媒体报道称，在英国，Wise 正在寻求获得英国银行牌照。《泰晤士报》文章称，该计划目前处于非常早期的阶段，公司尚未向英格兰银行正式提交牌照申请。这将是战略上的转变，因为过去 Wise 曾表示对完整银行牌照没有兴趣，而是专注于其作为货币服务业务（MSB）或电子货币机构的角色。尽管如此，在美国，Wise 已于 6 月向美国货币监理署（OCC）申请了全国信托银行牌照。这一举措应被视为积极信号，因为它将使 Wise 能够提供更多服务，但同时也会带来更多监管要求。

TMT Flows last week: Hardware - HF supply ASML, LO demand NOKIA, LO demand IFX (small). Software - LO demand SAP, LO supply TEMN (both very small). Telco - LO demand BT, Ongoing short covering SCMN, HF two way ORA better buyer, HF supply

Bouygues, HF demand TEL2, LO supply CLNX – flow ranked in order of size from large to small. Media – HF demand DHER post numbers, HF demand REL, ongoing unwind of VIV/UMG spread, LO supply PSON and Audio Trader; Gaming – HF supply FLTR
Communacopia + Technology 2025; Conference Preview from Eric on the Internet names
China Internet: Replay of the Webinar with Ronald on Food/instant delivery - BABA vs Meituan vs JD - Where to from here
AWAY FROM GS: Teamviewer BAML upgrade to buy.
GS toolkit: Franchise 360 – one- stop shop for signing up to Sector Specialists & thought leader distros from around the firm |

- WISE - Today press suggesting that in the UK Wise is looking to get a UK banking licence. The Times article says that the plans are understood to be at a very early stage and the company has not yet made a full application to the Bank of England for a licence. This would be a change strategy as in the past Wise as expressed no interest in a full banking license, focusing instead on its role as a money services business (MSB) or electronic money institution. That said in the US in June Wise applied for a national trust bank license application with the U.S. Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC). Should be seen as positive as will allow Wise to offer more services but will come with more regulation.

Nice new win (was out Friday) - MBSB Bank has launched International Remittance Service with Wise. It claims that MBSB Bank has potentially 22m customers (bigger than UniCredit win in July that was 15m, still waiting for Wise to confirm the 22m as it looks somewhat overstated search the interest on MBSB). The release highlights 55k Malaysians currently studying abroad and the new service is intended to provide a more reliable and transparent option for covering tuition fees, accommodation, living costs (large transactions) and other expenses. Wise is hosting its Wise Connect event on Sep 10 in SF when they might announce new wins (did that for Raiffeisen Bank).

- VAT Group – (followed by the Industrials team here) is upgrading to Buy. 3 reasons to Buy: 1) key beneficiary of a mid-term semi capex recovery, a bright spot in her capex tracker 2) upside to consensus; Daniela is now 3%/5% above consensus on FY25/26E adj. EBITDA driven by this more positive view on semi 3) depressed valuation vs history, with VAT underperforming the semi index and peers (-38pp vs multis +14pp and SOX +9pp over last 12m) reflecting pushed out timing on an expected semi capex recovery and concerns about China overstocking and US tariffs. The current share price is implying a 12m forward EBIT decline of 10% from the FY24 level, which is unwarranted according to Daniela. Her scenario analysis shows that even if VAT China sales decrease by 50%, it implies only 20% downside vs. 60% upside
in her bull case (assuming return to prior peak deviation from sales trend and peak margin/multiples). Buy with c.18% upside.

SEMIS: Under a notice published Friday, the Commerce Department said it was revoking waivers for Samsung and SK Hynix to use US technologies in their Chinese operations. The semiconductor companies had been operating in China under regulations that allow them to import chipmaking equipment without applying for a new license each time. The companies have 120 days until the waiver expires, and can seek licenses to continue operations, according to an announcement in the US Federal Register. Bloomberg Both Samsung and SK Hynix rely on China for a sizable portion of their memory chip production capacity. The two South Korean companies make components that are incorporated into smartphone and consumer electronics assembled in the country
- TSMC plans to increase foundry prices for its advanced semiconductor processes by approximately 5% to 10% in 2026, according to sources in the IC design industry.
- CAP: WNS said late Friday its shareholders approved its acquisition by Capgemini at meetings held on Aug. 29. This means that CAP should be on track to close WNS Acquisition by Year-End BBG
- Amadeus (out Friday) - July IATA air traffic data shows slight improvement relative to June, including in North America

- VodafoneThree is now connecting fixed-line broadband customers Community Fibre broadband. It allows Vodafone to offer Vodafone-branded full-fibre broadband services to over 1.3 million homes across London, complementing existing wholesale partnerships with Openreach and CityFibre. While in Germany Vodafone has frozen its wholesale agreement with Deutsche Glasfaser. The report says that Vodafone calls Deutsche Glasfaser's prices above the market average and "it is not possible to offer attractive deals". Telecom Paper

- Wolters - -ve read from OpenEvidence which will highlight the risk of increased competition in the space (Health is 20% of group and this is potential increased competition for Ovid and UptoDate within the segment). OpenEvidence operates a ChatGPT-like product for doctors to find health information, is considering multiple investment offers valuing the three-year-old startup at \$6 billion, nearly double its private valuation from a financing just one month ago, according to three people involved in the potential deal. If a deal happens, the company is likely to raise more than \$100 million. The Information
- BABA ADR +13% on back of strong Cloud growth and capex guidance (1QFY26 Cloud +26% yoy vs. +18% in 4QFY25 and GSe of 24%, w record high capex despite

foreign chip constraints \(+57\%\) qoq to Rmb39bn, and mgmt stay strongly committed to the 3- yr capex guidance of Rmb380b); on the other hand, food delivery losses were better- than- feared(vs. what was indicated by competitor)- mgmt implied that Sep quarter will be the largest loss drag to the group, GIR Ronald Keung now expects - Rmb31bn from quick commerce (vs. prior - Rmb20bn), widened from - Rmb11bn in June quarter (GSe), with loss per order to halve into the Dec quarter. We expect Alibaba's quick commerce market share to eventually settle at \(40\%\) (refreshing our long- term assumption to 5:4:1, from 5.5:3.5:1, between Meituan/Alibaba/JD). Flow front, we are seeing LO supply in Meituan post earnings.
- WPP: (Out Friday) Andrew Scott WPP Group COO to retire as COO at the end of the year
- Google – Press late Friday suggesting that Google set to face modest EU antitrust fine over adtech practices

- Perplexity: Taz Patel, head of advertising and shopping at the AI search startup Perplexity, has left the company after nine months, the startup confirmed to ADWEEK. Patel joined Perplexity in December 2024, and was tasked with building out the 3-year-old startup's fledgling ads business. He was previously chief revenue officer and co-founder of the influencer-marketing firm Captiv8, which was acquired by Publicis Groupe in May of this year.

- InPost acquires strategic minority stake in Bloq.it, poised to dominate European last-mile delivery. InPost will purchase more than 20,000 of Bloq.it's NEXT locker units and acquire a minority stake in the company.

- Communacopia Preview - Broadly, we expect investors to be focused on the following themes into and out of the conference: 1) the state of the global digital consumer – on the back of administrative announcements made during April 2025 and the implementation of reciprocal tariffs, forward commentary surrounding the level of visibility and linearity in consumer commerce trends heading into the holiday period remains in focus; 2) the digital advertising landscape – given continued momentum in the digital advertising environment from June through August, focus remains surrounding the level of sustained growth/improvement in the industry, along with elements of how companies are positioned for AI led advertising shifts, relative geographic, advertiser & ad outcomes (brand vs direct response) in the coming months; 3) company investments in AI – dynamics surrounding capital deployed, gaps between demand and capacity, scaling of AI efforts across consumer and enterprise computing & how companies are utilizing AI internally for productivity gains; & 4) the autonomous vehicle market - how the scaling of autonomous vehicles over the next 3-10 years might alter the mobility, transportation and delivery landscapes.

- Gaming Tracker 
-Early OSB data for July from 15 states indicates that win margins have continued to be somewhat better-than-average; however, GGR growth is more muted on a yoy basis given a tougher prior-year win margin comp (July OSB GGR is tracking at c.+2% yoy). Handle growth has remained broadly consistent with recent trends, with July handle c.+9% yoy. In terms of OSB GGR market share, July performance remains directionally consistent with the trend seen in recent months: FanDuel market share is tracking down c.-3pp yoy, DraftKings is broadly stable, BetMGM's market share is up slightly yoy, and Fanatics' market share continues to expand c.+3pp yoy. On an NGR basis, which is the revenue metric that matters for a company's financials, FanDuel retains a strong lead vs. competitors overall (FanDuel: c.42%, DraftKings: c.31% in June). iGaming same-state GGR growth continues to be very strong, c.+30% yoy in early July data. The national market share picture for the top 3 players on a GGR basis indicates continued yoy market share expansion for Flutter, while DKNG's market share continues to decline slightly yoy and BetMGM is broadly stable
Exhibit 9: In June, FanDuel's total market share was down c.-2pp yoy, while both DraftKings and BetMGM had broadly stable market share yoy Combined OSB and iGaming GGR market shares

Data only includes states that disclose operator-level GGR/NGR for OSB and/or IGaming, i.e., N1, N1, N1, N1, N1, N1, N1, N2, C1, M1, N1, N1, N1, N1, N1, N1. As a number of OSB-only states do not report operator-level data, this may include undetected market shares of Flutter and Duking, BetMGM is state that report multiple operators under the same license, we apply GS assumptions to derive the market shares of individual operators. Market share for each operator is calculated across all states listed above, including states where certain operators may not be active, and hence may not align with company-specific market share definitions. Pk iGaming data is N1.

- Fundamental LS managers up 0.4% this week (alpha: +0.6%), now up 2.2% MTD and up 10% YTD. Systematic LS managers up 0.3% this week, now up 2.3% MTD and up 12.3% YTD. Above average turnover week globally by highest on records in Asia. Global book was net bought driven by long buying exceeding short selling activity. All regions were net bought. Across sectors, Health Care, Real Estate and Financials were net sold while Info Tech, Industrials and Consumer Discretionary were net bought in large amounts. Industrials saw the largest long buying activity on record. Risk-off flows in Communication Services and Risk-on flows in Consumer Staples were among the largest weekly flows on record
Communication Services had the largest weekly risk- off flows since 2021 driven by short covering and long selling (1.2 to 1).
Weekly Gross Flows in Communication Services
Source GS prime data

What stocks are most topical / debated right now .. NVDA (any discovery value left?) ... GOOGL (strength? DoJ cares / timing?) ... CRM (is this cheap enough to work?) ... SPOT / NFLX / TTWO types (why so heavy lately?) ... CSCO (2- way dialogue post print) ... SNOW / MDB ('wow') ... PANW / CRWD (what do you do with these?)

Where was the biggest inflection this past month (stock, theme, sector, etc) ... Software - big negative inflection in Sentiment early in the month, despite only modest fundamental downticks during 2Q EPS season (lead- gen / top of funnel - per MNDY ... extended sales cycles - per BL or VERX). Bearish price action around early month earnings really set the tone (HUBS, DT, DDOG types) as AI anxiety crept in - - namely arguments that AI a disruptive force that changes (cannibalizes) pricing models, lowers the barrier to entry for new entrants, and ultimately compresses the profit pool available to leading SaaS incumbents .... Finally, some reprieve by month end with positive EPS related price action at the data / security layer (CRWD, MDB, SNOW), helped stabilize the narrative into a VERY busy month of Software analyst days & user conferences in September (15+ events)

What catalysts matter most next month .. GS Communacopia + Tech Conference: Sept 8- 11 in San Fran (agenda here) .... a couple presentations that jump out to me as we exit 2Q EPS .. AVGO (a Hock Tan appearance) .. MDB / SNOW / DDOG (3Q updates + AI framings) ... OpenAI & Anthropic (updates on LLM scaling &

productization) ... IBM (update on Software trends) .. META (update on AI products vs capex framing) .. Semicaps (LRCX, AMAT, KLAC – updated China / 2026 WFE views?) .. APP (Adam/CEO speaking) .. NOW / CRM (CEOs from both – all about AI positioning)
- What looks extended .. per 14-day RSIs Overbought: PI, ADI, WDC, GLW, COMM, BE, LITE, MDB, NCNO, LDOS, LUMN .. vs .. Oversold: AMAT, INTU, MNDY, VEX, FTNT, GLOB, IT, TTD, SNAP

- What note / topic / story is worth double-clicking on .. Tons of investor interest around GIR' s recent Silicon Valley AI trip where they met with several AI ecosystem players (VCs, the Stanford AI lab, and privates like Glean and Tera AI) - Link.

- Our DRAM sentiment indicator for August 2025 is pointing in a slightly positive direction (same as July). Notable highlights during the month include: 1) Consensus expectation for Hynix 2026 HBM pricing came down a bit but still more positive than our view, 2) Nanya revenue showed notable acceleration in yoy growth as the revenue starts to reflect exponential DDR4 pricing growth, and 3) server ODM and Aspeed revenue yoy growth continued to be strong but showed deceleration.  
- TrendForce's view on 3Q25 pricing growth (conventional DRAM: +10-15% qoq, blended DRAM: +15-20% qoq) is largely unchanged, which remains more positive than our view for the Korean memory companies (conventional DRAM: +HSD% qoq, blended DRAM: +low-teens% qoq). We believe this is partially influenced by the Korean companies having relatively small exposure in DDR4, where pricing growth has been the strongest.

- SG Micro's 2Q25 revenues beat (+21% YoY/ +30% QoQ, 13% ahead of GSe) reflect the recovery of signal chain IC and PMIC sectors supported by healthier inventory level across the supply chain. GM improved to 51.0% in 2Q25, slightly higher than GSe of 50.4% while still lower than 52.2% in 2Q24, reflecting the ASP recovery will take time amid the ongoing competitions. Amid competition, we expect the company to keep investing in R&D to develop new products and technologies, supporting long-term growth potential. While we are positive on SG Micro's competitive strength as a local analog leader, we remain Neutral rated on uncertainties regarding the pace of ASP / margin recovery and the growing competition in the analog space.

- AI/ALIBABA: Foreign press rpted that ALIBABA has developed a homegrown chip, which supposedly could rival NIVIDIA' s H20 chip. ALIBABA' s chip rptly will not be made by TSMC. -VE sentiment, although this doesn' t seem like a "DEEPSEEK" moment, so doesn' t feel like it will be a prolong selloff.  
- Mediatek (2454) is introducing its new flagship chip Dimensity 9500 this month. Oppo and Vivo are going to adopt the new chips first. (ED)

GUC (3443) joined Nvidia' s ecosystem NVLink Fusion, a positive for both Nvidia and GUC due to more collaboration in the ASIC space. (ED)- TSMC (2330) is expected to introduce new CPO technology "COUPE" during SEMICON (Sep 10- 12) in the coming weeks. The new technology will combine advanced packaging and high- speed connectivity for the next gen chips. (CT)- TSMC (2330) is said to raise its pricing by \(5 - 10\%\) for advanced packaging in 2026, while matured nodes will likely see some price cuts. (DT)- APPLE has told its supply chain to adopt factory automation in exchange for continuous orders. Apple is not expected to share the capex cost with the suppliers, indicating potential margin dilutions for the ODMs. (DT)

- Cambricon 12m TP raised by \(14.7\%\) to Rmb2,104 (implied \(45x2030E P/E\) by GIR, with 2030E EBITDA increased by \(8\%\) and 2030E target EV / EBITDA multiple increased by \(6\%\) . Co's revenues per engineer in the past 12 months increased to Rmb5m by June 2025 vs. Rmb2m by Dec 2024
Cambricon Al chips shipment and ASP trend (Source: GS GIR)

All references to "we/us/our" refer to the views and observations of the desk. All GS Global TMT research in one place – Click here
